variants.instructions:
1. Wrap lead wire on hook shank for weight.
2. Tie in marabou tail (twice shank length).
3. Tie in chenille body and palmer hackle forward.
4. Wrap chenille forward, secure hackle tip.
5. Whip finish and add head cement.

1. Tie in pheasant tail fibers as tail.
2. Wrap copper rib and pheasant body.
3. Build thorax with dubbing.
4. Pull pheasant fibers over to form wing case.
5. Finish with peacock herl head.

1. Dub a tapered body.
2. Palmer hackle through body.
3. Tie in elk hair wing over body.
4. Build neat head and whip finish.

1. Tie dumbbell eyes on top of hook shank.
2. Tie white bucktail on bottom as belly.
3. Tie chartreuse bucktail on top.
4. Add flashabou strands.
5. Secure head with thread.

1. Tie in tail with goose biots.
2. Dub muskrat fur body.
3. Palmer brown and grizzly hackle.
4. Tie in mallard wing.
5. Finish with thread head.

1. Tie bead head on hook.
2. Tie in pink or red chenille.
3. Wrap chenille forward in loose coils.
4. Secure and whip finish.

1. Tie cone head on hook.
2. Tie tinsel body.
3. Tie rabbit zonker strip over back.
4. Wrap strip forward, secure.
5. Add head cement.
